layout.close-browser-message: Close the browser or open an incognito window to log again.

welcome-page.description1: {{brandname}} is an in-memory data store that offers scalability, interoperability, and fault tolerance.
welcome-page.description2: Use high-performance caching capabilities and create distributed data grids designed for microservice architectures.
welcome-page.blog-description: The latest articles and news from Infinispan.
welcome-page.connect: Connect to {{brandname}} clusters with remote clients.
welcome-page.develop: Code applications for different use cases.

support.no-user-text: You must enter credentials to access the console. Create a username and password to continue.
support.text-create-user: Create a username and password then reload.
support.text-command: bin/cli.sh user create myuser -p changeme -g admin

cache-managers.title: Data container
cache-managers.no-caches-body: Click "Create a cache" and provide configuration in XML, JSON, or YAML format or use a custom template. You can also create caches from the CLI and remote clients.
cache-managers.no-filter-cache-body: No cache matches the filter or search criteria. Clear all filters and try again
cache-managers.cache-failed-status: caches health is Failed or Degraded

rebalancing.modal-description: Temporarily disable only to avoid repeated cluster rebalancing operations when restarting a node or adding multiple nodes. Always enable cluster rebalancing as soon as possible to prevent data loss.

tasks.no-tasks-body: Create tasks with the CLI or a remote client.
tasks.no-filtered-task-body: No tasks match your filter criteria.

counters.no-counters-body: Click "Create a counter" and configure a counter. You can also create counters from the CLI or remote clients.
counters.no-filtered-counter-body: No counters match your filter criteria. Click "Create a counter" and configure a counter.
counters.modal-delta-title: Set a value for the delta
counters.modal-delta-helper-invalid: Value must be respective to lower and upper bound
counters.modal-initial-value-invalid: The initial value must be between the lower bound and the upper bound inclusively
counters.modal-lower-bound-invalid: The lower bound must be less than the upper bound
counters.modal-storage-tooltip: {{brandname}} can save counter values in a persistent storage so the data is available when clusters restart. If you select a volatile storage, counter values are permanently deleted when clusters restart or stop
counters.modal-counter-type-tooltip: The value of a strong counter is stored in a single key for consistency. {{brandname}} recommends using strong counters when the counter's value is needed after each update or when a bounded counter is needed. The value of a weak counter is stored in multiple keys. The weak counter is suitable for use cases where the result of the update operation is not needed or the counterâ€™s value is not required too often
counters.modal-set-helper-invalid: The counter value must be between the lower bound and the upper bound inclusively

setup.page-title-with-backups: Configure a cache in {{cmName}} on site {{localsite}}
setup.page-title-description: You can generate a cache config. Note that the new cache will not be stored by {{brandname}}

getting-started.cache-setup-title: Select a way to configure your cache

delete.title: Permanently delete cache?
delete.body: and all of its data will be deleted.
delete.cache-name: Enter the cache name to delete it.

ignore.hide-body: You can show the cache again if you need to access it later.

create.page-title-with-backups: Create a cache in {{cmName}} on site {{localsite}}
create.cache-name-help: Enter a unique name for your cache.
create.cache-name-help-invalid: You must specify a unique name for each cache.
create.configuration: Cache configuration in XML, JSON, or YAML format
create.configuration-info: Use the distributed cache for demonstration purposes.
create.cache-configuration-docs: Need help? See "Configuring caches" in the documentation.
create.configuration-help-invalid: Cache configuration must be valid and conform to the schema.
create.templates-help: Create caches from a custom template.

getting-started.cache-name-label-help: Give your cache a unique name.
getting-started.cache-name-label-invalid: You must specify a cache name that does not already exist.
getting-started.cache-create-title: Select a way to create your cache
getting-started.cache-create-builder-help: Follow a series of prompts to create a cache.
getting-started.cache-create-add-help: Provide cache configuration in XML, JSON, or YAML format.

edit-config.cache-config: Enter valid XML, JSON, or YAML
edit-config.cache-config-invalid: Configuration must conform to the schema.
edit-config.demo-cache: Use the distributed cache for demonstration purposes.
edit-config.template-help-invalid: Select a template or enter a configuration

basic.title: Configure the basics
basic.mode-tooltip: Clustered caches can be distributed or replicated. Distributed caches offer linear scalability and efficient memory usage. Replicated caches offer data guarantees and fault tolerance.
basic.cluster-repl-tooltip: Clusters can replicate data between nodes using synchronous or asynchronous communication. Synchronous replication provides consistency but can slow down write operations. Asynchronous replication gives you better throughput for write operations but can lead to inconsistency and data loss.
basic.number-owners-tooltip: The number of owners that you select controls how many copies of each entry should exist in a distributed cache. Adding more copies reduces the risk of data loss but also reduces the overall cluster capacity. The number of nodes for a distributed cache should always be at least one more than the number of owners.
basic.encoding-cache-tooltip: Choose a media type that describes data that you store in the cache. Select ProtoStream encoding for optimal performance and interoperability between client applications.
basic.expiration-tooltip: Enable expiration to limit the amount of time that entries can remain in the cache. Expiration takes place across the cluster and removes entries based on a lifespan or maximum idle time.
basic.lifespan-tooltip: Set the amount of time that entries can remain in the cache after creation. If you set the lifespan value to -1, entries never expire.
basic.max-idle-tooltip: Set the amount of time that entries can remain in the cache after last access. If you set the maximum idle value to -1, entries never expire.

feature.alert-error: Complete all required fields before continuing.
feature.transactional-disabled: This cache can not be transactional
feature.transactional-disabled-description: Transactional caches are available in synchronous replication mode only. Remove the capability or chose synchronous replication.
feature.authorization-disabled-description: Authorization is available only when you configure {{brandname}} security and authorization, and the user has admin rights. Remove the capability or try with an admin role principal.
feature.backups-disabled-description: Backups are available only when you configure {{brandname}} to perform cross-site replication. Remove the capability or enable cross-site replication.
feature.secured-disabled-description: You must enable authentication and authorization in {{brandname}} Server to configure security. Remove the capability or enable security.
feature.indexed-disabled: This cache can not be indexed
feature.indexed-encoding-disabled-description: The encoding for indexed caches must be application/x-protostream and the selected encoding is {{encoding}}
feature.indexed-types-disabled-description: You must register a protobuf schema containing indexed protobuf entities to configure indexing in this cache.
feature.bounded-tooltip: To restrict the size of the cache, configure {{brandname}} to evict entries. You can set an eviction threshold based on the maximum amount of memory or based on the total number of entries that a cache can hold.
feature.max-size-tooltip: Configure a maximum size for the cache. When the cache reaches this threshold, {{brandname}} removes entries according to the eviction strategy that you configure.
feature.max-size-helper-invalid: You must specify a positive number
feature.max-count-tooltip: Configure the total number of entries that the cache can contain. When the cache reaches this threshold, {{brandname}} removes entries according to the eviction strategy that you configure.
feature.max-count-helper-invalid: You must specify a positive number
feature.eviction-strategy-tooltip: Specify how {{brandname}} should remove entries when the cache reaches the threshold that you configure. The REMOVE strategy evicts older entries to make space for new ones. The EXCEPTION strategy configures {{brandname}} to log an exception and prevent new entries from being created.
feature.indexed-tooltip: To enable faster queries and full-text search, build an index of cache values.
feature.indexing-mode-tooltip: Configure how {{brandname}} synchronizes cache operations with the index.
feature.index-storage-tooltip: Configure how {{brandname}} stores indexes. Persistent storage saves the index on the host file system so that the index is available between restarts. Volatile storage saves the index in JVM heap memory, which means that the index does not survive restarts. You should configure volatile index storage only for small datasets.
feature.index-storage-entity-tooltip: Specify the fully qualified class names of the entities you want {{brandname}} to include when building the index.
feature.index-storage-entity-helper: You must add at least one entity.
feature.index-sharding-tooltip: Divide the index data into multiple smaller indexes called shards. Enabling sharding distributes data across multiple shards, optimizing system resources and enhancing search capabilities.
feature.secured-description: To protect data, restrict user access to the cache. When a user does not have one of the roles selected from the menu below, {{brandname}} denies cache operations.
feature.select-roles-helper: You must select at least one role.
feature.backups-description: Configure {{brandname}} to replicate data in the cache of cluster {{localsite}} to another cluster.
feature.backups-site-tooltip: Select one or more remote sites to which {{brandname}} backs up data in the cache.
feature.select-sites: Select or type a site name
feature.select-sites-not-found: Site names list is empty. Type a site name
feature.merge-policy-tooltip: Specify how {{brandname}} resolves conflicting entries between backup locations when using the ASYNC strategy. You can specify one of the default merge policies or the fully qualified name of a class that implements the XSiteEntryMergePolicy interface.
feature.max-cleanup-delay-tooltip: Specify the maximum delay, in milliseconds, between which tombstone cleanup tasks run when using the ASYNC strategy.
feature.tombstone-map-site-tooltip: Specify the target number of tombstones, or key metadata, to store when using the ASYNC strategy. If the number of tombstones increases beyond this number then {{brandname}} runs the cleanup task more frequently. Likewise, if the number of tombstones is less than this number then {{brandname}} does not run the cleanup task as frequently.
feature.backup-for: This cache receives updates from cache with a different name
feature.backup-for-tooltip: Infinispan replicates data between caches that have the same name by default. Enable this option to specify the name and the location of the cache that will send data into this cache.
feature.remote-cache-tooltip: Specify the name of the cache on the remote site if it is different to the cache you are creating. {{brandname}} replicates data between caches that have the same name by default.
feature.remote-site-tooltip: Specify the name of the remote site where the backup cache is located, for example LON or NYC.
feature.strategy-tooltip: Configure how {{brandname}} replicates data to the remote site. Synchronous backups offer the strongest guarantee of data consistency but add latency, which reduces performance. Asynchronous backups have lower consistency guarantees but higher performance.
feature.two-phase-commit-tooltip: Enable two-phase commits for optimistic transactional caches with the SYNC backup strategy.
feature.failure-policy-tooltip: Select a failure policy that handles local writes to the cache if synchronous backup operations fail. IGNORE writes to the local cache and ignores the failed backup. WARN logs an exception and writes to the local cache. FAIL throws an exception and attempts to stop the write to the local cache. CUSTOM uses a custom implementation that you specify in the failure policy class field.
feature.timeout-tooltip: Specify the timeout, in milliseconds, for synchronous and asynchronous backup operations.
feature.failure-policy-class-tooltip: Specify the fully qualified name of a class that implements the CustomFailurePolicy interface if you select CUSTOM as the failure policy.
feature.take-offline-tooltip: Operations to replicate data across clusters are resource intensive. To excessive resource usage {{brandname}} can take backup locations offline automatically.
feature.after-failure-tooltip: Set the number of consecutive failures that can occur for backup operations before sites go offline. Specify a negative or zero value to use minimum wait time only.
feature.min-wait-tooltip: Set the minimum time to wait, in milliseconds, before sites go offline when backup operations fail. If subsequent operations are successful, the minimum wait time is reset. If you set 'after-failures', sites go offline when the wait time is reached and the number of failures occur. One or two minutes is generally a suitable time to wait before automatically taking backup locations offline. If the wait period is too short then backup locations go offline too soon. You then need to bring clusters back online and perform state transfer operations to ensure data is in sync between the clusters.
feature.state-transfer-tooltip: Modify state transfer operations that synchronize data between sites.
feature.chunk-size-tooltip: Specify how many cache entries are batched in each transfer request.
feature.timeout-state-transfer-tooltip: Specify the time to wait, in milliseconds, for the backup site acknowledge the state chunk received and applied. The default value is 20 minutes.
feature.max-retries-tooltip: Set the maximum number of retry attempts for push state failures. Specify a value of 0 (zero) to disable retry attempts. The default value is 30.
feature.wait-time-tooltip: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retry attempts for push state failures. You must specify a value of 1 or more. The default value is 2000.
feature.mode-tooltip: Control whether state transfer happens manually on user action, which is the default, or automatically when backup locations come online. {{brandname}} can perform automatic state transfer with the ASYNC backup strategy only.
feature.transactional-description: To allow {{brandname}} to participate in JTA-compliant distributed transactions, configure transaction and locking modes.
feature.transactional-mode-tooltip: To ensure a consistent cache state, configure the mode that {{brandname}} uses to complete transactions.
feature.non-xa-tooltip: {{brandname}} enlists the cache with the Java transaction manager through the Synchronization API. This means that {{brandname}} does not participate in transactions but receives notifications about the transaction lifecycle. You should use the NON_XA mode when there is an external system that handles transactions, for example when {{brandname}} provides a second-level (2LC) cache.
feature.non-durable-xa-tooltip: {{brandname}} disables transaction recovery and enlists the cache with the Java transaction manager through the XAResource API. Disabling recovery means that you cannot recover failed transactions but do not have the performance overhead of handling in-doubt transactions.
feature.full-xa-tooltip: {{brandname}} uses transaction recovery and enlists the cache with the Java transaction manager through the XAResource API. Using recovery provides durability by marking transactions as in-doubt when they fail. FULL_XA can impact performance by reducing cluster capacity when storing in-doubt transactions and by increasing traffic for failed transaction notifications.
feature.locking-mode-tooltip: Configure how {{brandname}} locks keys to perform write operations for transactions. Locking keys adds contention that increases latency for write operations. You can adjust the amount of contention by using optimistic or pessimistic locking.
feature.locking-mode-optimistic-tooltip: {{brandname}} locks keys when it invokes the commit() method. Keys are locked for shorter periods of time which reduces overall latency but makes transaction recovery less efficient.
feature.locking-mode-pessimistic-tooltip: {{brandname}} locks keys when it invokes the put() method. Keys are locked for longer periods of time which increases latency but makes transaction recovery more efficient.
feature.persistent-description: Add non-volatile storage so data remains available after cluster restarts. You can also load caches from persistent storage and use {{brandname}} for high performance data access.
feature.persistent-error: Persistent storage configuration must be in JSON format and conform to the {{brandname}} schema.
feature.persistent-hint: The provided configuration is an example template that you should modify for your environment.
feature.persistent-hint-link: Need help? See "Configuring persistent storage" in the documentation.
feature.persistent-storage-jar-warning: {{persistentStorage}} require a JAR added to the classpath before you can configure persistent storage.
feature.passivation-tooltip: Enable passivation to keep only frequently used data in the cache. {{brandname}} writes entries to persistent storage when it evicts those entries from memory.
feature.connection-attempts-tooltip: Specify how many times {{brandname}} should try to connect to the cache store. The default value is 10.
feature.connection-interval-tooltip: Set the interval, in milliseconds, between connection attempts. The default value is 50.
feature.availability-interval-tooltip: Set the interval, in milliseconds, between which {{brandname}} polls the cache store to ensure it is available. The default value is 1000.
feature.storages-tooltip: Select a cache store that configures {{brandname}} to interact with a persistent data source.
feature.file-store-description: Use the local host filesystem for persistent storage. For clustered caches, file-based cache stores are unique to each {{brandname}} node.
feature.remote-store-description: Use a cache on another {{brandname}} cluster for persistent storage. Remote stores connect through the Hot Rod endpoint and are required to perform rolling upgrades for {{brandname}} clusters.
feature.jdbc-store-description: Use a relational database for persistent storage through a JDBC connection. You must ensure that the appropriate JDBC driver is available to the {{brandname}} cluster.
feature.table-sql-store-description: Load entries from a single database table to your {{brandname}} cache. You must ensure that the appropriate JDBC driver is available to the {{brandname}} cluster.
feature.query-sql-store-description: Perform SQL queries to load entries from one or more database tables, including sub-columns. You can also perform insert, update, and delete operations. You must ensure that the appropriate JDBC driver is available to the {{brandname}} cluster.
feature.rocks-db-description: Use RocksDB as a cache store. A RocksDB cache store uses two databases; one as a primary store and another to hold expired entries.
feature.custom-description: Use a custom cache store that you implement with the {{brandname}} Persistence SPI.

advanced-options.storage-tooltip: Caches can store data in JVM heap memory or in off-heap memory. JVM heap is a managed memory space. Off-heap storage is native system memory outside JVM memory management. Off-heap storage uses less memory per entry compared with JVM heap storage and can improve performance by avoiding avoids garbage collection (GC) runs.
advanced-options.locking-tooltip: To control read and write data access, configure the concurrency level and locking settings of the cache.
advanced-options.concurrency-level-tooltip: Configures the number of locks to create in the shared pool for lock striping.
advanced-options.isolation-level-tooltip: Read isolation levels guarantee whether or not data in the cache has changed during a transaction.
advanced-options.isolation-level-repeatable-read-tooltip: Read operations return the same value that {{brandname}} initially retrieves for an entry during a transaction. This is the default read isolation level because it guarantees consistency.
advanced-options.isolation-level-read-committed-tooltip: Read operations might return different values if another transaction modifies the entries.
advanced-options.lock-acquisition-timeout-tooltip: Sets how many milliseconds to wait for lock acquisition.
advanced-options.striping-tooltip: Uses a shared pool of locks for all entries in the cache. Striping lowers the memory footprint for locks but can reduce concurrency. If you disable striping, a lock is created for each entry in the cache.
advanced-options.index-tuning-tooltip: To optimize cache performance, specify the methods that {{brandname}} uses to interact with the index.
advanced-options.refresh-interval-tooltip: Set the interval, in milliseconds, to refresh the index reader so that search results are up to date.
advanced-options.low-level-trace-tooltip: Enable low-level trace information for indexing operations. Enabling this attribute substantially degrades performance. You should use low-level tracing only as a last resource for troubleshooting.
advanced-options.commit-interval-tooltip: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, that index changes buffered in memory are flushed to index storage. The index commit has a performance cost so you should not set a low value.
advanced-options.max-buffered-entries-tooltip: Set the maximum number of entries that can be buffered in-memory before they are flushed to index storage. Large values result in faster indexing but use more memory. When used in combination with the ram-buffer-size attribute, a flush occurs for whichever event happens first.
advanced-options.queue-count-tooltip: Set the number of internal queues to use for each indexed type. Each queue holds a batch of modifications that is applied to the index and queues are processed in parallel.
advanced-options.queue-size-tooltip: Set the maximum number of elements each queue can hold. Increasing the queue-size value increases the amount of memory that is used during indexing operations. Setting a value that is too small can block indexing operations.
advanced-options.ram-buffer-size-tooltip: Set the maximum amount of memory that can be used for buffering added entries and deletions before they are flushed to the index storage.
advanced-options.thread-pool-size-tooltip: Specify the number of threads that execute write operations to the index.
advanced-options.calibrate-by-deletes-tooltip: Includes the the number of deleted entries in an index when counting the entries in the segment. Disabling results in more frequent merges caused by max-entries, but will more aggressively merge segments with many deleted documents, improving query performance.
advanced-options.factor-tooltip: Sets the number of segments that are merged at once. With smaller values, merging happens more often, which uses more resources, but the total number of segments will be lower on average, increasing query performance.
advanced-options.max-entries-tooltip: Sets the maximum number of entries that an index segment can have before merging. Segments with more than this number of entries are not merged. Smaller values perform better on frequently changing indexes, larger values provide better search performance if the index does not change often.
advanced-options.min-size-tooltip: Sets the minimum target size of segments, in MB, for background merges. Segments smaller than this size are merged more aggressively. Setting a value that is too large might result in expensive merge operations, even though they are less frequent.
advanced-options.max-size-tooltip: Sets the maximum size of segments, in MB, for background merges. Segments larger than this size are never merged in the background. Settings this to a lower value helps reduce memory requirements and avoids some merging operations at the cost of optimal search speed.
advanced-options.max-forced-size-tooltip: Sets the maximum size of segments, in MB, for forced merges and overrides the max-size attribute. Set this to the same value as max-size or lower. Setting the value too low degrades query performance because documents are deleted.
advanced-options.backups-tuning-tooltip: Configure cross-site replication settings for backup locations.
advanced-options.stop-timeout-tooltip: Sets the amount of time, in milliseconds, that {{brandname}} waits for ongoing transactions when the cache is stopped.
advanced-options.complete-timeout-tooltip: Sets the maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that transactions can run. {{brandname}} aborts transactions that do not complete before reaching the timeout.
advanced-options.reaper-interval-tooltip: Sets the amount of time, in milliseconds, between which {{brandname}} checks if transactions are complete.

review.review-subtitle: Check the configuration for your cache before you create it. You can go back or start over if you need to make changes.
review.download-description: Download the configuration file for your cache. You can use this file to create the cache using the CLI, REST API or Operator.
review.formatting-loading: Validating and formatting the configuration to xml, yaml and json.

configuration.title: Available cache templates
configuration.no-templates-body: Add cache templates to the server configuration.
configuration.no-filtered-templates-body: No counters match your filter criteria. Clear all filters and try again
configuration.no-encoding-warning: This cache either has no encoding configuration or uses an encoding that the console does not support. You must use Hot Rod clients to perform read and write operations on this cache.
configuration.encoding-docs-message: See "Cache Encoding and Marshalling" in the documentation.
configuration.pojo-encoding: This cache uses "{{encodingKey}}" encoding for keys and "{{encodingValue}}" for values. {{brandname}} Console might not fully support data manipulation or displaying entries for caches that don't use ProtoStream encoding.

entries.column-lifespan-tooltip: Sets the number of seconds before the entry is automatically deleted. If you do not set this parameter, {{brandname}} uses the default value from the configuration. If you set a negative value, the entry is never deleted.
entries.column-maxidle-tooltip: Sets the number of seconds that entries can be idle. If a read or write operation does not occur for an entry after the maximum idle time elapses, the entry is automatically deleted. If you do not set this parameter, {{brandname}} uses the default value from the configuration. If you set a negative value, the entry is never deleted.
entries.empty-cache-body: There is no entries yet. Click the button below to create a new entry.
entries.no-filtered-entry-tooltip: No entry match your search criteria. Click "Add entry" or clear search.
entries.pagination-tooltip: Shows up to 100 entries of the cache
entries.modal-clear-body-line-one: This action will permanently clear all entries in
entries.modal-delete-body-line-one: This action will permanently delete the key
entries.modal-delete-body-line-three: You can always recreate the entry after.
entries.add-entry-maxidle-invalid: The maximum idle value must be a number
entries.add-entry-maxidle-help: If you set a negative value, the entry is never deleted.
entries.add-entry-lifespan-invalid: Time to live must be a number.
entries.add-entry-lifespan-help: If you set a negative value, the entry is never deleted.
entries.add-entry-form-key-tooltip: The key can contain JSON or Protobuf values, depending on cache encoding.
entries.add-entry-form-value-tooltip: The value can contain JSON or Protobuf values, depending on cache encoding.
entries.add-entry-form-lifespan-tooltip: Sets the number of seconds before
entries.add-entry-form-maxidle-tooltip: Sets the number of seconds that entries can be idle.

query.ickle-query-tooltip: {{brandname}} provides an Ickle query language that lets you create relational and full-text queries.
query.query-metrics-tooltip: Average time, in nanoseconds, for queries on this cache.
query.modal-button-query-clear-stats-body: All query statistics in this cluster will be removed.

rebalancing.modal-description: Disabling rebalancing prevents the cluster from repairing data in this cache belonging to nodes leaving the cluster. It should be re-enabled as soon as possible to prevent possible data-loss in this cache.

availability.modal-available-description: will become available for read and write operations.

cache-metrics.average-reads-tooltip: Average time, in milliseconds, for read operations to complete.
cache-metrics.average-writes-tooltip: Average time, in milliseconds, for write operations to complete.
cache-metrics.average-deletes-tooltip: Average time, in milliseconds, for delete operations to complete.
cache-metrics.data-access-hits-info: Hits displays the number of successful requests for cache entries.
cache-metrics.data-access-misses-info: Misses displays the number of times that a client requested an entry that was not in the cache. Misses occur when an entry is never stored in the cache or after an entry is evicted from the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-stores-info: Stores displays the number of write operations that put entries in the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-retrievals-info: Retrievals displays the number of read operations that get entries from the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-remove-hits-info: Remove hits displays the number of successful requests to delete cache entries.
cache-metrics.data-access-remove-misses-info: Remove misses displays the number of times that a client attempted to delete an entry that was not in the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-evictions-info: Evictions displays the number of entries that have been evicted from the cache. Eviction removes entries from the cache when it reaches a configured threshold.
cache-metrics.approximate-entries-tooltip: Displays the approximate number of entries that are stored in the cache. May include replicas.
cache-metrics.approximate-unique-entries-tooltip: Displays the approximate unique number of entries that are stored in the cache. Each entry is counted only once so the number does not include replicas.
cache-metrics.approximate-entries-in-memory-tooltip: Displays the approximate number of entries in memory. May include replicas.
cache-metrics.min-nodes-tooltip: Displays the number of nodes that must remain in the cluster to avoid data loss.
cache-metrics.cache-size-off-heap-tooltip: Displays the amount of off-heap memory that data in the cache uses. Total memory usage is higher because it includes internal data structures.
cache-metrics.cache-size-heap-tooltip: Displays the amount of JVM heap memory that data in the cache uses. Total memory usage is higher because it includes internal data structures.
cache-metrics.data-distribution-tooltip: Displays the amount of data that is stored in each node in the cluster.
cache-metrics.data-distribution-no-filtered-body: No result found for searched value. Clear the filter and try again
cache-metrics.cache-started-since-info: Elapsed time in seconds since the cache was started.
cache-metrics.cache-reset-since-info: Elapsed time in seconds since the statistics were last reset.

schemas.no-schema-body: Click "Create a Protobuf schema" and provide schema.
schemas.no-filter-schema-body: No schema match your search criteria. Clear search and try again
schemas.name: Name

create.name: Name
create.schema-tooltip: Protobuf schema describe entries in your caches so you can query them.

delete.heading: Delete schema?
delete.modal-description-1: will be permanently deleted in {{brandname}} Server. Caches using this schema will be affected.
delete.modal-description-2: You can always recreate the schema.

edit.heading: Edit schema
edit.modal-description-1: You are about to change the schema of

global-stats.title: Global statistics
global-stats.global-stats-disabled-help: Statistics are disabled. To  statistics, set statistics=true in the configuration.
global-stats.cluster-wide-stats-tooltip: Statistics for all caches across the cluster.
global-stats.current-entry-in-memory: Current number of entries in memory
global-stats.data-access-stats-tooltip: Data access statistics for all caches across the cluster.
global-stats.data-access-hits-info: Refers to the successful retrievals of requested items from this cache.
global-stats.data-access-misses-info: Refers to the unsuccessful retrievals of requested items from this cache.
global-stats.data-access-stores-info: Refers to the stores (put) operations in this cache.
global-stats.data-access-remove-hits-info: Refers to the successful removals of requested items in this cache.
global-stats.data-access-remove-misses-info: Refers to the unsuccessful removals of requested items in this cache because requested items are missing.
global-stats.data-access-evictions-info: Refers to the process of removing items from this cache to make room for new items when the cache is full.
global-stats.operation-performance-values-tooltip: Average values, in milliseconds, for operations on all caches across the cluster.
global-stats.cache-manager-lifecycle-tooltip: Lifecycle values, in milliseconds, for the Cache Manager.
global-stats.cluster-distribution-tooltip: Displays the number of nodes in the cluster.
global-stats.global-stats-enable-msg: Global statistics for all caches in the cluster
global-stats.global-stats-disable-msg: You must enable global statistics in the Cache Manager configuration to display values.

cluster-membership.title: Cluster membership
cluster-membership.no-cluster-body: Add nodes to create a cluster.

connected-clients.title: Connected clients
connected-clients.connected-clients-description: List and filter connected clients to this cluster

access-management.title: Access management
access-management.description: Access management allows you to control {{brandname}} Server administration.

roles.role-name-tooltip: Role name prefixed with a lock indicates that the role is predefined and cannot be edited.
roles.no-roles-body: You can create a role to manage access to {{brandname}} Server administration.
roles.no-filtered-roles-body: No roles match your search criteria.
roles.permission-read: Allows reading data from a cache
roles.permission-bulk-read: Allows bulk-read operations on a cache
roles.permission-write: Allows writing data to a cache
roles.permission-bulk-write: Allows bulk-write operations on a cache
roles.permission-create: Allows creation of resources (caches, counters, schemas, tasks)
roles.permission-listen: Allows attaching listeners to a cache
roles.permission-lifecycle: Allows control of a cache's lifecycle
roles.modal-delete-description-1: The role {{name}} will be permanently deleted in {{brandname}} Server. Caches using this role will be affected.
roles.modal-delete-description-2: You can always recreate the role.
